intro: Calonyction pulcherrimum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense heads. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in rocky or dry habitats. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, though it can become invasive in some areas.
